Today I, Riko Yamagishi, am graduating from Tsubaki Factory and Hello Project.
First of all, I'd like to start by saying that dancing was the only thing I loved since I was a little girl, and I always wanted to be the best at recitals and events.
But other than that, I've always tried to hide behind others and keep a low profile in my life.
I applied for the trainee program not because I wanted to be an idol, but because I wanted to be a back-up dancer at Hello Project concerts.
I applied for the trainee program because I wanted to be a back-up dancer at Hello Project concerts rather than an idol, but they chose me as a trainee and a member of Hello Project.
I can't thank you enough for choosing me as a trainee and allowing me to work as a member of Tsubaki Factory until today.
Through my activities, I realized how cool and sparkling idols are.
Hello Project has made me realize how cool and sparkling idols are.
I am probably the least suited to be a leader among the group members.
I became the leader of the group and was almost crushed by the pressure every day.
When I looked at old videos, I thought I was doing the best I could at the time, but I was still somewhat intimidated and confident.
But I felt I was doing my best at that time, but I was looking somewhat frightened and unsure of myself.
I would like to thank all the members who have followed and supported such an unreliable leader.
I am filled with gratitude.
And the person who has supported me the most up to now is
I would like to express my gratitude to all the members who have supported me so far.
